alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Miami; Wyandotte (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 27 at 2:27AM CST until February 27 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Wyandotte County in northeastern Kansas... Eastern Miami County in east central Kansas... Johnson County in east central Kansas... Northwestern Cass County in west central Missouri... Southwestern Clay County in west central Missouri... Southeastern Platte County in west central Missouri... Western Jackson County in west central Missouri... * Until 300 AM CST. * At 226 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Shawnee to Spring Hill to near Paola, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Overland Park, Olathe, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Shawnee, Lenexa, Leawood, Raytown, Liberty, Gladstone, Grandview, Belton, Prairie Village, Raymore, Merriam, Mission, Smithville, Bonner Springs and Paola. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 411 and 423. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 212 and 235. Interstate 29 between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 635 between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 470 between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 435 between mile markers 0 and 13, between mile markers 39 and 42, and between mile markers 47 and 83. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
